title: Conditional Probability Formula
text: The conditional probability of B given A may be computed by means of the following formula: P(B$$\mid$$A)=P(A$$∩$$B)/P(A)

title: P(A$$∩$$B)
text: What is the probability that the first die is 3 AND the sum is 7? Enter you answer as a fraction

subHints.title: P(A$$∩$$B)
subHints.text: There are $$6\times6=36$$ ways the two dice can land. Of those 36, only 1 satisfies the conditions "the first die is 3" AND "the sum is 7" (3 and 4). Thus $$P(A\$\$ \cap \$\$B)=\frac{1}{36}$$

title: P(A)
text: What is the probability that the first die is 3? Enter you answer as a fraction

subHints.title: P(A)
subHints.text: There are 6 ways the first die can land. Of those 6, only 1 of them satisfies the condition "the first die is 3" so $$P(A)=\frac{1}{6}$$

title: P(B$$\mid$$A)
text: Using P(A$$∩$$B) and P(A), solve for P(B$$\mid$$A) using the conditional probability formula: P(B$$\mid$$A)=P(A$$∩$$B)/P(A)
